title: SRA Raw Data
Description: Metadata required for public data obtained from the Sequence Read Archive (SRA)

Age.description: Age of patient sample was collected from in years

AssayType.description: NGS assay performed to generate data

AssemblyName.description: GenBank assembly accession for reference genome

AvgSpotLen.description: Average number of base pairs in a single spot (aka read length)

Bases.description: Total number of nucleotide bases in a sequencing dataset for a given sample

BiomaterialProvider.description: Name of provider supplying input sample material

BioProject.description: SRA term. Research project or study and encompasses various types of data, including sequencing data, associated with that project

BioSample.description: SRA term. Biological sample that has been used in an experiment or study. Each BioSample record contains information about the biological source, such as the organism, tissue, and individual characteristics.

BioSampleModel.description: SRA term. Model or schema used to define structure information of a BioSample record. In the case of tissue samples, this often refers to the species.

Bytes.description: Size of the file in bytes when downloaded from SRA database

CenterName.description: Name of center profiling cell line

Consent.description: Level of consent to publish cell line data

DataStoreFileType.description: SRA file format or storage structure used in the SRA data storage system

DataStoreProvider.description: Provider used to host SRA data

DataStoreRegion.description: Region SRA data is hosted in

Disease.description: Name of disease/cancer type cell line sample was generated from

Ethnicity.description: Descent of patient cell line was derived from

Experiment.description: SRA refers to a specific set of conditions under which sequencing data was generated. It includes details such as the sequencing platform used, library preparation methods, and other experimental parameters.

FlowCellID.description: Flow cell ID for sequencing run sample was profiled on

Isolate.description: Source of assay input material eg, substrate nucleic acid extraction performed on

LibraryLayout.description: Whether a library contains single ended or paired reads

LibrarySelection.description: Type of nucleic acid fragments (DNA, RNA ...) selected and isolated for sequencing

LibrarySource.description: Original nucleic acid source for library

Organism.description: Organism sample was derived from, in latin

ReleaseDate.description: Date data was released on SRA database

Sex.description: Sex of patient sample originated from

SRAStudy.description: Study ID from Sequence Read Archive (SRA) database associated with sample

CreateDate.description: Date data record was created in SRA

CreateDateBatch.description: Simplified create_date field to represent data generation batches, custom field in format YYYY-MM-DD

PatientID.description: ID for patient sample was acquired from. Not required to be unique, may have obtained multiple samples from the same patient

AnnotationSource.description: Cancer cell line initiative that annotated sample

CancerType.description: High-level cancer type cell line was derived from

CancerTypeDetailed.description: Detailed description of cancer type cell line was derived from
enum: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
Undifferentiated Pleomorphic Sarcoma/Malignant Fibrous Histiocytoma/High-Grade Spindle Cell Sarcoma
Uterine Carcinosarcoma/Uterine Malignant Mixed Mullerian Tumor

CellLineSource.description: Origin source of cell line, often name of institution that derived or provided cell line to the study

Characteristics.description: Free form description of cell line characteristics, especially as they pertain to growth patterns and morphology

DepMapID.description: Cell line ID on the Dependency Map (DepMap) portal profiling cancer vulnerabilities of cell lines

DiseaseOntology.description: Disease ontology, similar to detailed cancer type, as defined by cbioportal
enum: diffuse large cell lymphoma non-cleaved type
well differentiated invasive eosphageal squamous cell carcinoma

DoublingTimeHrs.description: Approximate time, in hours, for cell line population to double

FractionGenomeAltered.description: Percentage of genome that has been affected by copy number gains or losses, as calculated by cBioportal

FreezingMedium.description: Medium used to crysopreserve cell lines, often refers to percentage DMSO added to cell culture medium

GenomeDoublings.description: Number of duplications of the entire set of chromosomes within a cell for a given cell line

GrowthMedium.description: Cell culture or growth media, is an umbrella term that encompasses any gel or liquid created to support cellular growth in the lab

Histology.description: Histology of tumor cell line was derived from, as defined by microscopic examination of excised tissue from biopsy or resection

HistologySubtype1.description: More detailed histological information on tumor cell line was derived from. NS=not specified

HistologySubtype2.description: Even more detailed histological information on tumor cell line was derived from. NS=not specified

LifeStage.description: Whether cell line was dervied from an adult or pediatric tumor

Lineage.description: High-level description of cancer lineage corresponding to cel line

LineageMolecularSubtype.description: Molecular subtype of tumor cell line was derived from

LineageSubtype.description: Lineage subtype of tumor cell line was derived from, more detailed than Lineage

LineageSubSubtype.decription: Lineage sub-subtype of tumor cell line was derived from, more detailed than bath Lineage SubType & Lineage

MutationCount.description: Total  number of non-synonymous mutations in cell line as reported by cBioportal

MutationRate.description: Mutations per megabase of the genome

OncotreeCode.description: OncoTree is an open-source ontology that was developed at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (MSK) for standardizing cancer type diagnosis from a clinical perspective by assigning each diagnosis a unique OncoTree code.

PathologistAnnotation.description: Cancer type of tumor cell line was derived from according to pathologist

Ploidy.description: Ploidy is the number of complete sets of chromosomes in a cell, baseline unaltered ploisy in humans is 2

PrimaryTumorSite.description: Location of primary tumor in patient cell line was derived from. If the cell line is derived from a metastasis, the primary tumor location may differ from the anatomical location the cell line source material was collected from.

Proteomics10PlexID.description: Cell line ID for Proteomics 10-Plex assay to align datasets by sample

ProteomicsTMTLabel.description: Tandem Mass Tag (TMT) used in proteomics of cell line in paired dataset

Purity.description: Proportion of cells in sample of malignant origin, a value of 1 denotes 100% tumor cells in sample

SiteOfFinding.description: Location of tumor cell line was derived from

SiteSubtype1.description: Detailed site location of tumor cell line was derived from

SiteSubtype2.description: Detailed site location of tumor cell line was derived from, more detailed than Site Subtype 1

Subtype.description: Tumor subtype cell line was derived from
enum: Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC), Adenosquamous Carcinoma
Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC), Large Cell Carcinoma
Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC), Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma
Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC), Squamous Cell Carcinoma

Supplements.description: Additivies to cell line growth medium

TMBNonSynonymous.description: Tumor Mutation Burden (TMB), number of nonsyn mutations per MB of DNA, as calculated by cBioportal
